content.content: Weekly MIPs Update #80   1031×586 25.5 KB   March Ratification Polls Just Closed     — RFC and FS Dates for reference and for existing proposals can be seen on this proposal tracker (WIP). If you have any questions about the voting process at MakerDAO, the Practical Guide to Voting will be useful.  The nine March Ratification Polls that entered the Monthly Cycle closed today at 16:00 UTC. All passed.     Proposal Final Results      MIP61: Recognized Delegates Compensation"Governance Facilitators will compute and send the compensation to Recognized Delegates starting from the MIP adoption date with payments sent monthly."    799×175 8.86 KB  Go to voting page     MIP63c4-SP2: Onboard/Amend Keeper Network - Keep3r Network"This is an onboarding application for Keep3r Network. A decentralized, permissionless keeper network."    799×175 7.95 KB  Go to voting page     MIP63c4-SP3: Onboard/Amend Keeper Network - Gelato Network"Gelato Network is Web3’s automation network, enabling developers to automate a wide variety of arbitrary smart contract executions on and across all EVM-based compatible blockchains such as Ethereum."    799×175 7.95 KB  Go to voting page     MIP4c2-SP17: Rapid Payment for Small Bug Bounties (MIP64, MIP40c3-SP42 Amendment)"The current bug bounty payment process is adequate for large payouts, but inconvenient for small payouts. This MIP adds a small payout process."    799×175 8.61 KB  Go to voting page     MIP13c3-SP12: Declaration of Intent - Invest in short-term bonds"As of writing, around 60% of the MakerDAO balance sheet is in stablecoin. We are often above 50% of stablecoin for the last 18 months. This provides no revenues for MakerDAO, provides bad PR and significant counterparty risk on Circle, and to a lesser extent on Paxos. MakerDAO governance wish for any party to provide a comprehensive solution to this matter."    799×175 8.6 KB  Go to voting page     MIP40c3-SP60 Modify GovAlpha Core Unit MKR Budget"This budget consists of two key parts, retroactive compensation for @LongForWisdom and an MKR Compensation framework for GovAlpha. Overall, this proposal would commit 227.64 MKR to GovAlpha contributors, covering MKR compensation for the Core Unit from its inception. This is approximately 67.06 MKR/FTE/Year. Subsequent requests will take place every 6 months, featuring the same 12-month cliff. Contributors do not forfeit their vesting upon leaving GovAlpha, providing that their departure is a smooth transition and there have been no serious ethical breaches."    799×175 7.93 KB  Go to voting page     MIP40c3-SP59: GovAlpha Budget 2022-23"MIP40c3-SP59 adds a 12-month DAI budget of 1,109,793 DAI for the GovAlpha Core Unit starting in April 2022. This will be implemented via a 89,983 DAI per month stream and an initial transfer of 30,000 DAI."    799×175 8.07 KB  Go to voting page     MIP40c3-SP61: Modify Core Unit Budget - Real-World Finance (RWF-001)"MIP40c3-SP61 modifies the Dai budget for the Real-World Finance Core Unit. Based on the new vision for structured finance applications 1, which includes a more thorough legal review process, and the currently available funds, a higher budget cap is proposed to ensure the proper operations of the Core Unit."    799×175 8.75 KB  Go to voting page     MIP41c5-SP5: Facilitators Offboarding  This proposal has been rendered obsolete as MDS-001 Facilitators have stepped down on their own accord.    799×175 8.92 KB  Go to voting page      Weekly-Cycle Ratification Polls   We have two ongoing weekly-cycle Ratification Polls that will run for three days.     Proposal Voting Portal      MIP55c3-SP3: SPF ETHAmsterdam Event"The purpose of this subproposal is to allocate 50,000 DAI for the MakerDAO event in Amsterdam scheduled between April 20-24, 2022."  Go to voting page    MIP4c3-SP2: MIP62 Amendment"This subproposal amends MIP62c2 and MIP62c3 to reflect the offboarding of the Content Production Core Unit (MKT-001) that occurred with the passage of MIP41c5-SP3 and MIP40c3-SP49."  Go to voting page     Latest Proposals in RFC   There are 20 recent/active proposals with RFC status, most of which are eligible to enter the April Governance Cycle. You can check which will possibly enter which Governance Cycle on the rightmost column. We also have one weekly-cycle subproposal. Where proposals use anything other than the usual one-month Feedback Period and one-week Frozen Period, you can click on their rightmost entry to check their periods as per the process component that defines them.  Also please keep in mind that proposals that have a one-week Frozen Period shouldn’t be modified after Wednesday lest they be left out of the April Governance Cycle       Proposal Author Governance Cycle      MIP65: Project Clydesdale: Monetalis Arrangement I: Liquid Bond Strategy & Execution"The MIP intends to 1) set up a starting Liquid Bond Strategy to replace part of the Maker USDC funds; 2) select a professional fund manager for the execution of the above strategy; 3) set up a Maker Execution and Governance Operating platform necessary for implementation; 4)implement and Deploy USDC [TBD]; 5) devise a staged plan for further deployment."  @Allan_Pedersen Monthly (April)    MIP66: Pairwyse Licensure"Pairwyse is an active protocol and blueprint for creating bespoke fixed-rate DAI lending and investment Agreements on MakerDAO between borrowers and lenders. We wish to thank the Maker Community for its previous feedback concerning the negative impact of patents on open source projects and potential concentration risks posed by fixed-rate innovations currently incubating in the Maker ecosystem. In posting this MIP, we wish to directly address these shared concerns with a fresh proposal we feel is favorable for Maker DAO, its contributors, its users and all current and future DeFi innovators throughout the collective ecosystem."  @Akiva Monthly (April)    MIP67: Methodology Review and Process for Structured Finance Transactions"MIP67 intends to formalise the methodology and high-level process to evaluate structured finance transactions made under the MIP6 application process."  @williamr Monthly (April)    MIP68: Monetalis Vault V2"MIP68 is a self-contained collateral onboarding MIP that will onboard and activate a RWA vault backed by the assets of a trust arranged by Monetalis."  @Allan_Pedersen Monthly (April)    MIP69: L2-to-L1 Fast Withdrawals"Teleporting DAI from L2 to L1 is known as a “Fast Withdrawal”. To complete a fast withdrawal, DAI is burnt on L2, minted on L1, and sent to the user as soon as the L2 transaction is confirmed. This MIP focuses on the above L2 to L1 transaction. L2 to L2 transactions will be defined in a future MIP when the full wormhole functionality is ready to be launched."  Protocol Engineering (PE-001) Monthly (May)    MIP39c2-SP30: Governance Communications Core Unit, COM-001 (Mandate Refresh)“The Governance Communications Core Unit performs a set of programs that focus on MakerDAO’s informational accessibility, stakeholder coordination, and communication practices as a decentralized and public organization.”  @DavidUtro Monthly (April)    MIP6c3-SP2: Modify the Collateral Application Form"The goal is therefore to amend the collateral application template to contain relevant questions that allow Core Units and the MakerDAO community to more easily make an informed opinion on whether or not a collateral type is fit to be greenlit to be onboarded into the Maker Protocol."  @monkey.irish Monthly (April)    MIP40c3-SP66, MIP41c4-SP33, MIP39c2-SP32: Events Core Unit Onboarding (EVENTS-001)“The Events Core Unit will handle planning, organization, and execution of MakerDAO branded events. Our vision is to use an exhaustive list of themes, visuals, set dressing, technology and branding to carry out events to the highest standards for the MakerDAO community.”  @PonJerry Monthly (April)    MIP4c2-SP18: MIP7 Amendments"Due to the expansion of the MakerDAO Core Units (CU) and the focus on crypto native and real world assets (RWA), a Domain Team is requested to be added to better support the collateral onboarding process: Collateral Engineering Services Team"  @monkey.irish Monthly (April)    MIP7c3-SP7: CES Domain Team Onboarding"Collateral Engineering Services Domain Team is a new Domain Team proposed in MIP4c2-SP18 and is currently in RFC."  @monkey.irish Monthly (April)    MIP4c2-SP15: Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments"Recent events have shown the process for involuntarily offboarding facilitators and core units could be improved. These changes are an attempt to make the process more transparent, orderly, and conducive to substantive discussion surrounding an offboarding proposal prior to a vote."   @gfxlabs, with @twblack88 currently running point on it Monthly (April)    MIP40c3-SP67: Modify Core Unit Budget - Strategic Happiness (SH-001)“MIP40c3-SP67 updates the budget to expand the Strategic Happiness Core Unit, SH-001.It includes a proposal for a new budget breakdown for DAI and MKR”  @aburban90 Monthly (April)    MIP40c3-SP62: Modify Core Unit Budget, COM-001"MIP40c3-SP62 slightly modifies the existing budget for COM-001 and extends funding to the end of December 2022."  Upon its passing, MIP40c3-SP62 will be carried out unless MIP40c3-SP63 passes, in which case the latter will be carried out.  @DavidUtro Monthly (April)    MIP40c3-SP63: Modify Core Unit Budget, COM-001"MIP40c3-SP63 significantly modifies the existing budget for COM-001, adding a fourth FTE, and extends funding to the end of December 2022."  @DavidUtro Monthly (April)    MIP40c3-SP64: Add Data Insights Core Unit Budget"This subproposal adds the budget for Data Insights Core Unit. It’s a regular monthly budget of 88,600.00 DAI from May 2022 until April 2023, included"  @tmierzwa Monthly (April)     MIP39c2-SP31: Update Data Insights Core Unit Mandate"This subproposal modifies the Data Insights Core Unit (DIN-001) mandate previously ratified with MIP39c2-SP22. It’s mostly about simplification of the previous document and stressing of our focus on L2 and cross-chain data as well as RWA datasets."  @tmierzwa Monthly (April)    MIP40c3-SP68: Modify Protocol Engineering Core Unit Budget - (PE-001)“This subproposal is requesting a 12 month Budget of 7,590,000 DAI for the Protocol Engineering Core Unit starting from May 2022. This will be implemented via a 632,500 DAI per month stream using DssVest.”  @Derek Monthly (April)    MIP47c3-SP1: Dissolution of Content Production (MKT-001) Multi-Sig Request"Now that the Content Production Core Unit has been offboarded, their wallet should be removed from the recognized multi-sig list. Currently, no funds are available in the multi-sig, but it can still claim ~3.8k DAI from their canceled budget stream."  @prose11 Monthly (April)    MIP4c2-SP19: MIP40 Budget Process Amendment Subproposal"For the DAO to grow long-term, it is critical that MKR holders be able to evaluate and compare Budget Proposals with minimum cognitive overhead. Within this revised MIP, Core Units and proposed Core Units are required to submit standardized, transparent and clear financial information. Budget Proposals must clearly serve a revenue-driving or supporting business purpose in line with the Objectives of the DAO."   @Aes, @adcv, @SebVentures  Monthly (May)    MIP4c3-SP3: Amend MIP64 to allow more flexibility in scope"During February 2022, we had two bug submissions for web vulnerabilities that were troublesome to categorize (post-mortems coming soon). A month later, bounties for these bugs are still being negotiated. A great deal of time was spent trying to find resolutions that seemed fair to both sides, for the whitehats and DUX. The change here would give more discretion to IS-001 to determine the bug bounty scope. This will allow us to refine the rules to reduce gray areas and potential disagreements."  @Psychonaut Weekly       Things to Come    The last day of modifications for proposals that can enter the April Governance Cycle is March 30, 2022. The next Formal Submission Window will be open from Monday, April 4th through Wednesday 6th. To enter the May Governance Cycle, a proposal must be posted on the forum on April 6th at the latest.    oh btw  I’m definitely forgetting something We’ve finally reached #80! This is a very important number For anything MIP-related: reach out to @gala, @sebix, or @blimpa!    Pre-MIP Discussions  Anti-inflationary Proposal Auction-backed DAI IAM for Surplus Buffer Proposal Ideas on the Forum [Pre-MIP] Using Gyroscope to cut through Dai’s Gordian knot: its USDC dependency An RWA style solution to replace the PSM
I’m totally going to steal the dropdown details arrow thing, haha
This topic was automatically closed 14 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Weekly MIPs Update #81   952×714 28 KB   Two Weekly-Cycle Polls Closed Last Week Two Short Ratification Polls (three-day polls for proposals that enter the Weekly Cycle) went up on Monday 28 and closed on Thursday 31 with the results that follow:     Proposal Final Results      MIP55c3-SP3: SPF ETHAmsterdam Event"The purpose of this subproposal is to allocate 50,000 DAI for the MakerDAO event in Amsterdam scheduled between April 20-24, 2022."    1137×212 10.7 KB  Go to voting page     MIP4c3-SP2: MIP62 Amendment"This subproposal amends MIP62c2 and MIP62c3 to reflect the offboarding of the Content Production Core Unit (MKT-001) that occurred with the passage of MIP41c5-SP3 and MIP40c3-SP49."    1137×212 9.72 KB  Go to voting page     Both proposals passed. The MIP62 amendments have been merged. The SPF disbursement will go into an executive as soon as the multisig details have been sorted out.  We Have an Ongoing Signal Request to Promote MIP4c3-SP3 On-Chain As per MIP4c3, MIP4c3-SP3: Amend MIP64 to Allow More Flexibility in Scope is a weekly-cycle subproposal that requires a Signal Request passing with at least 51% before being promoted on-chain. That Signal Request is now live and will run for one week. Please go vote!  The April Formal Submission Window is Now Open     — RFC and FS Dates for reference and for existing proposals can be seen on this proposal tracker. If you have any questions about the voting process at MakerDAO, the Practical Guide to Voting will be useful.  The April Formal Submission Window is now open and will remain so until EOD Wednesday 6. This is relevant for proposals that enter the Monthly Governance Cycle and have fulfilled their Feedback Period and complied with their Frozen Period—and are therefore eligible to enter the April cycle.     Proposal Author Formally Submitted?      MIP65: Project Clydesdale: Monetalis Arrangement I: Liquid Bond Strategy & Execution"The MIP intends to 1) set up a starting Liquid Bond Strategy to replace part of the Maker USDC funds; 2) select a professional fund manager for the execution of the above strategy; 3) set up a Maker Execution and Governance Operating platform necessary for implementation; 4)implement and Deploy USDC [TBD]; 5) devise a staged plan for further deployment."  @Allan_Pedersen Awaiting confirmation      MIP66: Pairwyse Licensure"Pairwyse is an active protocol and blueprint for creating bespoke fixed-rate DAI lending and investment Agreements on MakerDAO between borrowers and lenders. We wish to thank the Maker Community for its previous feedback concerning the negative impact of patents on open source projects and potential concentration risks posed by fixed-rate innovations currently incubating in the Maker ecosystem. In posting this MIP, we wish to directly address these shared concerns with a fresh proposal we feel is favorable for Maker DAO, its contributors, its users and all current and future DeFi innovators throughout the collective ecosystem."  @Akiva Awaiting confirmation      MIP67: Methodology Review and Process for Structured Finance Transactions"MIP67 intends to formalise the methodology and high-level process to evaluate structured finance transactions made under the MIP6 application process."  @williamr Yes      MIP68: Monetalis Vault V2"MIP68 is a self-contained collateral onboarding MIP that will onboard and activate a RWA vault backed by the assets of a trust arranged by Monetalis."  @Allan_Pedersen Awaiting confirmation      MIP39c2-SP30: Governance Communications Core Unit, COM-001 (Mandate Refresh)“The Governance Communications Core Unit performs a set of programs that focus on MakerDAO’s informational accessibility, stakeholder coordination, and communication practices as a decentralized and public organization.”  @DavidUtro Yes      MIP6c3-SP2: Modify the Collateral Application Form"The goal is therefore to amend the collateral application template to contain relevant questions that allow Core Units and the MakerDAO community to more easily make an informed opinion on whether or not a collateral type is fit to be greenlit to be onboarded into the Maker Protocol."  @monkey.irish Yes      MIP40c3-SP66, MIP41c4-SP33, MIP39c2-SP32: Events Core Unit Onboarding (EVENTS-001)“The Events Core Unit will handle planning, organization, and execution of MakerDAO branded events. Our vision is to use an exhaustive list of themes, visuals, set dressing, technology and branding to carry out events to the highest standards for the MakerDAO community.”  @PonJerry Yes      MIP4c2-SP18: MIP7 Amendments"Due to the expansion of the MakerDAO Core Units (CU) and the focus on crypto native and real world assets (RWA), a Domain Team is requested to be added to better support the collateral onboarding process: Collateral Engineering Services Team"  @monkey.irish Yes      MIP7c3-SP7: CES Domain Team Onboarding"Collateral Engineering Services Domain Team is a new Domain Team proposed in MIP4c2-SP18 and is currently in RFC."  @monkey.irish Yes      MIP40c3-SP62: Modify Core Unit Budget, COM-001"MIP40c3-SP62 slightly modifies the existing budget for COM-001 and extends funding to the end of December 2022."  Upon its passing, MIP40c3-SP62 will be carried out unless MIP40c3-SP63 passes, in which case the latter will be carried out.  @DavidUtro Yes      MIP40c3-SP63: Modify Core Unit Budget, COM-001"MIP40c3-SP63 significantly modifies the existing budget for COM-001, adding a fourth FTE, and extends funding to the end of December 2022."  @DavidUtro Yes      MIP40c3-SP64: Add Data Insights Core Unit Budget"This subproposal adds the budget for Data Insights Core Unit. It’s a regular monthly budget of 88,600.00 DAI from May 2022 until April 2023, included"  @tmierzwa Yes       MIP39c2-SP31: Update Data Insights Core Unit Mandate"This subproposal modifies the Data Insights Core Unit (DIN-001) mandate previously ratified with MIP39c2-SP22. It’s mostly about simplification of the previous document and stressing of our focus on L2 and cross-chain data as well as RWA datasets."  @tmierzwa Yes      MIP40c3-SP68: Modify Protocol Engineering Core Unit Budget - (PE-001)“This subproposal is requesting a 12 month Budget of 7,590,000 DAI for the Protocol Engineering Core Unit starting from May 2022. This will be implemented via a 632,500 DAI per month stream using DssVest.”  @Derek Yes      MIP47c3-SP1: Dissolution of Content Production (MKT-001) Multi-Sig Request"Now that the Content Production Core Unit has been offboarded, their wallet should be removed from the recognized multi-sig list. Currently, no funds are available in the multi-sig, but it can still claim ~3.8k DAI from their canceled budget stream."  @prose11 Yes       Latest Proposals in RFC   These proposals are still being worked on and need your feedback.     Proposal Author      MIP69: L2-to-L1 Fast Withdrawals"Teleporting DAI from L2 to L1 is known as a “Fast Withdrawal”. To complete a fast withdrawal, DAI is burnt on L2, minted on L1, and sent to the user as soon as the L2 transaction is confirmed. This MIP focuses on the above L2 to L1 transaction. L2 to L2 transactions will be defined in a future MIP when the full wormhole functionality is ready to be launched."  Protocol Engineering (PE-001)    MIP4c2-SP19: MIP40 Budget Process Amendment Subproposal"For the DAO to grow long-term, it is critical that MKR holders be able to evaluate and compare Budget Proposals with minimum cognitive overhead. Within this revised MIP, Core Units and proposed Core Units are required to submit standardized, transparent and clear financial information. Budget Proposals must clearly serve a revenue-driving or supporting business purpose in line with the Objectives of the DAO."   @Aes, @adcv, @SebVentures     MIP4c2-SP15: Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments"Recent events have shown the process for involuntarily offboarding facilitators and core units could be improved. These changes are an attempt to make the process more transparent, orderly, and conducive to substantive discussion surrounding an offboarding proposal prior to a vote."   @gfxlabs, with @twblack88 currently running point on it    MIP40c3-SP67: Modify Core Unit Budget - Strategic Happiness (SH-001)“MIP40c3-SP67 updates the budget to expand the Strategic Happiness Core Unit, SH-001.It includes a proposal for a new budget breakdown for DAI and MKR”  @aburban90    These proposals are eligible to enter the May Governance Cycle.    Things to Come    The Ratification Polls for the current Governance Cycle will go up on Monday 11. To enter the May Governance Cycle, a proposal must be posted on the forum on April 6th at the latest.    oh btw For anything MIP-related: reach out to @gala, @sebix, or @blimpa!
